Is the Tiger a member of the Felidar family?	No.
Is the Tiger a member of the Felidar family?	No.
Is the Tiger a member of the Felidar family?	No
Are tigers solitary animals?	Yes.
Are tigers solitary animals?	Yes
Are panthers a type of tiger?	No.
Are panthers a type of tiger?	No
What do tigers' powerfully built legs and shoulders allow tigers to do?	They have the ability to pull down prey substantially heavier than themselves.
What do tigers' powerfully built legs and shoulders allow tigers to do?	have the ability to pull down prey substantially heavier than themselves
What would a tiger do when seized by a crocodile?	A tiger will strike at the reptile's eyes with its paws.
What would a tiger do when seized by a crocodile?	strike at the reptile's eyes with its paws
What are the typical features of a tiger country?	It will always have good cover, it will always be close to water and plenty of prey.
What are the typical features of a tiger country?	Good cover, close to water, and plenty of prey 
Would it be common for tigers to mate in January?	Yes.
Would it be common for tigers to mate in January?	Yes
About how many square kilometers would be needed to house 3 female tigers?	60 square kilometers
About how many square kilometers would be needed to house 3 female tigers?	60
Would a tiger be likely to feedon smaller animals, such as mice?	Yes
